file_insights.purpose: Barrel export file for form components module

patterns_discovered.description: Organized barrel exports with component and corresponding type exports grouped together
examples: export { TextInput } from './TextInput'; export type { TextInputProps } from './TextInput'
export { TextareaInput } from './TextareaInput'; export type { TextareaInputProps } from './TextareaInput'

patterns_discovered.description: Aggregated all base types and shared type definitions in a single export block at end of file
Props types follow consistent naming convention: ComponentNameProps

gotchas_discovered.description: If any form components import from shared types file, ensure the types file doesn't re-export from components to avoid circular dependency issues
No verification that all exported components and types actually exist in their respective files
Assumes existence of './types' file containing all base type definitions - this file's presence was not verified

approach_outcome.description: Successfully created a barrel export file for all form components
approach_outcome.key_accomplishment: Established a centralized entry point for importing form components and their types, improving code organization and reducing import path complexity

recommendations.description: Add a build-time or pre-commit validation to ensure all exported components and types actually exist in their source files
Update all internal imports across the codebase to use the new barrel export path (from './components/forms') instead of individual component paths
Add documentation explaining the barrel export pattern and how to properly add new form components to this index file
If the forms directory grows significantly, consider creating sub-barrels for grouping related input types (e.g., basic inputs vs. complex inputs)
